1947.info: Creation of 'Atlantic Records', a major label in R&B who will further sign Ray Charles, Ruth Brown...

1949.info: The Billboard changed the name of the Race Records chart to Rhythm & Blues Records for music of African American Origin destined to a black audience

1950.info: Ruth Brown sing 'Teardrops from My Eyes', a title that made her earn the title of 'Queen of the R&B'

1951.info: Johnny Otis, 'the Godfather of Rhythm and Blues' hit 3 time the top R&B chart with  'Double Crossing Blues', 'Mistrustin' Blues' and 'Cupid's Boogie'

1957.info: Elvis Presley enter Rhythm and Blues Billboard chart with 'Jailhouse Rock' and 'All Shook up', an unprecedent acceptance of a non-African American artist into a music category known for being created by blacks

1960.info: Start of mob culture in UK influenced by R&B music, there music is named as British Rythme and Blues
Music industry start labeling Rhythme and Blues form white artist under genre of Blue Eyed Soul

1963.info: Billboard combine its pop and R&B chart because there were too similar

1964.info: The Rolling Stones publish there first eponym ablum composed laregly of R&B songs
R&B music starts to be involved in Civil Rights movement with Sam Cooke's 'A change is gonna come' and Curtis Mayfield’s 'Keep on Pushing'
Early blue-eyed soul single 'You've Lost That Lovin' Feelin'' by The Righteous Brothers

1965.info: The Who record there first album 'My Generation' under 'Maximum R&B' genre
The Billboard changed name for music of African American Origin to 'R&B'

1968.info: James Brown release his single 'Say It Loud – I'm Black and I'm Proud', an unofficial anthem of the Black Power movement
New Grammy is added for Best Rhythm and Blues Song, giving to the genre an academic recognition, its first winner is Otis Redding with '(Sittin' On) The Dock of the Bay'

1969.info: The Billboard renamed African American Origin music to from 'R&B' to 'soul'

1980.info: Contemporary R&B is created after the demise of disco in the 80s it is 'a genre of smooth pop music that is entirely centered on the vocalist' and different from original Rhythm and Blues music

1982.info: The Billboard renamed African American Origin music to from 'soul' to 'black'

1986.info: Release of Control album by Janet Jackson, 'Control is regarded as one of the most influential albums in the history of rhythm and blues and the first album to bridge the gap between R&B and rap music.', it also popularize new jack swing genre.

1988.info: George Nelson, music editor to Billboard describe the development of retail outlets for R&B records in a book named 'The Death of Rhythm and Blues'

1989.info: Mariah Carey 'Vision of love' single becomes reach the number 1 US Billboard Hot 100 and popularize melisma (singing of a single syllable of text while moving between several different notes in succession) in R&B

1990.info: The Billboard finally changed the soul category to 'R&B' and it remains until today to represent more a type of music than a the race of an audience

1995.info: First Grammy Award for Best R&B Album goes to II by Boyz II Men

1996.info: R. Kelly with nickname 'the king of R&B' release 'I believe I can fly' and win 3 Grammy awards

2003.info: The music journalist Robert Christgau said 'Modern r&b isn't about discrete songs. It's about texture, mood, feel—vocal and instrumental and rhythmic, articulated as they're smooshed together.'
